basicAuth.description: HTTP Basic Authentication. Works over HTTP and HTTPS

put.description: Creates a new case

Creates a new document within an existing case. An ID for the document is
not required in the request.

Updates a document. This method can be used for both renaming a document
as well as for uploading new content. For renaming, the request does not
need to provide content. For uploading new content, there is no need to
provide a file name. Will not update an external ID.
Updates a documents metadata.

get.description: Returns a a document given its ID.

Returns a a documents content given its ID. The return value is Base64
encoded.

delete.description: Deletes a document based on its ID

get.description: Lists all cases
Lists all active (non-archived) cases

put.description: Creates a new party in a given case.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The parties metadata. Use an ID for a party type as involvementType. Available types can be retrieved using /v1/cases/party/types.

get.description: Lists all party types as configured in the system

put.description: Updates a party.

delete.description: Deletes a party from a case based on its ID

put.description: Updates an existing case based on its ID. The file number is immutable.

get.description: Returns all case metadata based on its ID
Returns a list of documents for a given case
Returns a list of documents for a given case that have been moved to the trash bin but are not finally deleted yet
Returns all due dates for a given case
Returns a list of forms for a given case
Returns a list of all parties involved in a case
Returns all tags attached to the case give by its ID

put.description: Creates a new contact

get.description: Lists all contacts

post.description: Performs a similarity search using Jaro Winkler distance over name, first name, street and number, zip code and city. Anything with a similarity of 85% or higher will be returned.

put.description: Updates an existing contact based on its ID

get.description: Returns a contacts metadata given its ID

put.description:
Creates a new form within an existing case. An ID for the form is not
required in the request. The value for placeholder must be unique within
the cases forms, you cannot have two different forms with the same
placeholder. Creating a form does not create empty dummy values for it. A
client needs to explicityly set the entries or rely on a user editing it
through the UI.

get.description: Lists all form types

delete.description: Deletes a document based on its ID

get.description: Returns all form entries based on a forms ID

put.description:
Updates ALL entries for an existing form. A client must provide ALL
entries for the form. Updating a subset of entries is not supported. The
services can be used to either create an initial set of entries for a
form or to update exinsting entries.

get.description: Returns this API backends metadata, such as API level. This can be used by a client to determine the capabilities of this backend.

put.description:
Creates a new case. This service supports extended file numbers
(including prefix, suffix, group and user).

Updates an existing case based on its ID. The file number is immutable.
This service supports extended file numbers (including prefix, suffix,
group and user).

get.description:
Returns all case metadata based on its ID. This service supports extended
file numbers (including prefix, suffix, group and user).
Returns a contacts metadata given its external ID

parameters.name: extId
parameters.description: the contacts external ID value, expected in the specified external id with index {extIdIndex}

parameters.name: extIdIndex
parameters.description: the index of the external id column. Valid values are 1..5.

get.description: Returns a contacts metadata given any of its external IDs

parameters.name: extId
parameters.description: the contacts external ID value - which may be persisted in any of the five supported external ID columns

get.description:
Returns a list of contact metadata given the name of a tag that is
applied to these contacts

parameters.name: tag
parameters.description: the tag to be used for searching contacts

put.description: Creates a new contact

Updates an existing contact based on its ID. The external ID of the
contact is only changed if provided by the client as a non-empty string.
Setting the external ID to null / empty is not possible using this
endpoint.

get.description: Returns a contacts metadata given its ID
Returns all folder templates configured in the system.
Returns the folder structure of a given case.

put.description: Applies a folder template to a case.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: the ID of the folder template to be applied

get.description: Returns all calendars configured in the system
Returns all calendars accessible by the given user

parameters.name: principalId
parameters.description: user id as used e.g. when logging in

get.description: Returns all due dates for all non-archived cases
Returns all due dates for a given case
Returns all tags attached to the document given by its ID

delete.description: Deletes a documents tag given the tags ID.

put.description: Creates a document tag. dateSet is optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the tag to be added. its id may be empty.

get.description: Returns IDs of all cases to be synced to the requesting users devices

parameters.name: principalId
parameters.description: user name for whom syncable cases are requested

put.description: Enables or disables the synchronization of a given case for the requesting user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: tuple of case id, user name and a boolean flag that indicates whether or not to sync

delete.description: Deletes a cases tag given the tags ID.

get.description: Returns all history entries for a given case

put.description: Creates a case tag. dateSet is optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the tag to be added. its id may be empty.

delete.description: Deletes a contacts tag given the tags ID.

get.description: Returns all cases for the contact given by its ID
Returns all tags attached to the contact given by its ID

put.description: Creates a contact tag. dateSet is optional.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the tag to be added. its id may be empty.

get.description:
Returns a documents content in the form of a data bucket, given its
ID.The return value is Base64 encoded.

put.description: Performs OCR on a PDF document. Existing PDF is replaced with its OCRed equivalent.
Converts a document to PDF.

Creates a new due date within an existing case. An ID for the due date is
not required in the request.
Updates a due date.
Creates a history entry for a case.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the history entry to be added. its id and case id may be empty. its principalId is discarded when provided by the caller and automatically populated based on the API users authentication. Provide the date / time in UTC in a format like this: "2022-05-01T13:42:37Z[UTC]"

put.description:
Returns a a documents content in the form of a data bucket, given its ID. The return value is Base64
encoded.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the bucket formerly retrieved by the client, with an empty payload!

get.description: Returns all security groups set up in the security

Returns all user available in the security who have at least the permission
 to log in
Returns a users metadata given its external ID

put.description: Creates a new user. No permissions will be granted. Does currently not support all attributes.

get.description: Lists all users, including ones without login permission
Returns the folder structure holding document templates.
Returns all document templates in the given folder.

Returns all placeholders keys for a given template in a given folder,
using the given case. Case is needed to resolve potential forms
placeholders (AKA Falldaten).

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: the file name of the template

put.description:
Creates a new document based on a template.Any place holders are
automatically populated, but a client may override them. Invoice creation
not supported.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: file name of the document to be created, without file extension (server will enforce same extension as template)

parameters.name: folder
parameters.description: the template folder hierarchy starting with /

parameters.name: template
parameters.description: the file name of the template

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: key-value pairs holding placeholder values, used for overriding defaults / existing values

get.description: Lists all available email templates.

Returns a specific email template with all placeholders filled with case
data. Default parties will be used.

parameters.name: caseId
parameters.description: The ID of the case to fill placeholders from

parameters.name: templateName
parameters.description: Name of the template to retrieve

post.description:
Triggers a backup run and returns its status. The job ID may be used to
check on the execution status of the job.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the credentials under which to perform the backup

get.description: Lists all jobs currently known to the server. Note that jobs are not persistent, restarting the server will result in an empty status list.
Returns the status of a specific job.

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: the ID of the job to check

get.description: Returns a cases metadata given its external ID
Returns cases that have a given tag applied to them

put.description:
Checks whether or not a document (as specified in the request) may
currently be added to the given case. Note that a client should then add
the document directly after performing the check, otherwise there may be
other clients who add same-named documents in the meantime. Checks are
performed in a case-insensitive manner, even if some operating systems
allow that.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the request object describing a document to be added to the case

get.description: Lists a cases allowed groups.

put.description: Updates a cases allowed groups. All allowed groups must be submitted in one request - existing permissions will be overwritten, not added to. This endpoint can also be used to reset security for a case by sending an empty list of groups. Providing the ID of a group is sufficient.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: the groups allowed to access the case

get.description: Returns a list of instant messages for a given case

Returns all option groups available in the system who have at least one
value configured.Some important option groups are: address.country: all
countries address.degreeprefix: all degrees appearing before the name
address.degreesuffix: all degrees appearing after the name
address.profession: all professions address.role: all roles, such as
"CEO" etc. archiveFile.subjectField: all subject fields for cases
address.salutation: archiveFile.tags: all tags that can be attached to a
case address.tags: all tags that can be attached to an address
document.tags: all tags that can be attached to a document address.title:
timesheet.intervalminutes: all intervals usable for timesheets, in
minutes address.titleinaddress: address.complimentaryclose:
address.legalform: all types of legal entities address.nationality: all
nationalities invoice.currency: all currencies invoice.taxrates: all tax
rates as decimal numbers
Returns all options for an option group.

put.description:
Creates a new option within an existing option group. An ID supplied by
the caller will be ignored.

delete.description:
Creates a new option within an existing option group. An ID supplied by
the caller will be ignored.

put.description: Renames an existing option. This will only impact master data, e.g. it will not rename tags attached to a case / address / document. A client is supposed to submit an option that can be found by its ID. Other attributes (such as the name) will be updated.
Marks a specific mentioning of a user in a message as done.

get.description: Returns a list of instant messages the requesting user has access to, created up to x seconds in the past

parameters.name: seconds
parameters.description: number of seconds - only messages created after this point in time in the past are retrieved

put.description:
Submits a new message. An API client should not provide mentions along with the message,
they will be automatically extracted based on the content of the message.

delete.description: Deletes a message based on its ID

get.description: Lists all logs for executed web hooks and their basic information.
Returns a specific web hooks execution log by its ID

parameters.name: hookId
parameters.description: the id of the web hook
